meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with trees or foliage.
meanings.sent1: The little cottage was embowered by tall oak trees.
meanings.sent2: The garden was embowered by colorful flowers and lush greenery.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to embower itself with leaves to hide from the cat.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were embowered by the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The forest embowered the hikers in a peaceful embrace.

meanings.definition: To shelter or protect with trees or foliage.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree embowered the weary travelers from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: The dense forest embowered the animals from the harsh winter winds.
meanings.sent3: The birds embowered themselves in the thick branches to escape the rain.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella embowered her from the sudden downpour.
meanings.sent5: The canopy of leaves embowered the picnic area in cool shade.
